message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.MM

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with shadow detection and recovery from a single image using a structured CNN learning framework. The paper also proposes a shadow/bright measure to model complex interactions among image regions, which is a common problem in computer vision. Additionally, the paper uses optimization techniques to solve the shadow recovery problem efficiently, which is a common approach in computer vision and machine learning. The paper may also be relevant to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories due to the use of deep learning techniques and optimization methods. The paper may also be relevant to the graphics (cs.GR) and multimedia (cs.MM) sub-categories due to the focus on image processing and analysis.
